title: Does anyone in the economy gain from a high inflation? - Quora

response.answer_text: Debtors, c.f. Williams Jennings Bryan's "Cross of Gold" speech Mesmerizing the Masses.Any person or organization with pricing power.Investors who are short lenders or debt instruments, e.g., bonds;  banks; bank-like companies; bond surrogates--i.e., high yielding stocks, and lots of other things.People with Cost of Living Adjustments (COLAs) in their pensions, e.g., SocSec.People who sell real inflation hedges.People who sell inflation hedge schemes.
Yes, those with fixed-rate loans or mortgages, as their repayments will diminish in value over periods with high inflation.

If all prices as well as wages were to inflate at the same rate the only costs would be the "menu" cost of having to reset prices and also the costs of recalculating things in doing ones planning. But if some prices are sticky or fixed, there can be winners and losers, and inflation *might* reduce unemployment.
